Key Arguments: The proposed legislation threatens freedom of speech and democratic rights.
Existing organizations and laws already address issues of misinformation and disinformation.
The bill lacks clarity and transparency, particularly regarding the role and qualifications of ACMA.
Truth is subjective and can vary between individuals; the legislation may suppress diverse perspectives.
The bill unfairly targets online platforms while ignoring biases in mainstream media.
Exemptions for certain groups create an imbalance in treatment and protection of free speech.
Notable Quotes: I hold sincere concerns that this proposed amendment will limit our democratic right to ‘Freedom of Speech’ and reduce people’s right to a voice, for fear of punishment and/or retribution.
How can there be one universal truth when truth is different things to different people?
I am of the strong opinion that this feels like a Big Brother movement, designed to control and monitor free speech, and prevent freedom of thought.
